channel.title: Top Level Folder called Content on Unbounded School
channel.description: Recent content in Top Level Folder called Content on Unbounded School

item.description: What I would do with 1,000,000 dollars is buy toys for my sister, nice dresses and earrings for my mom, and Reeses and new shoes for my dad. Then, I would buy lot of beautiful fabric and art materials. Last, I would go all around the world in amazing private plane. That’s just some things I would do with 1,000,000 dollars!

item.title: Schedule
item.description:
Daily

Time Lesson
8:30 Math & Logic
9:45 Recess
10:00 DEAR
10:30 Social Studies
11:15 Lunch
11:30 Recess
12:00 Literacy
1:00 Daily Writing
1:30 Projects
2:15 Music & PE
3:15 End of Day

Math & Logic

Khan Academy is the primary math curriculum. After completing grade-level material, supplement with Beast Academy or Math Academy. Once mastered, advance to the next grade on a limited basis, reducing math to 2–3 days weekly to prioritize Logic, Technology, and Science. For example, replace some math with Learning to Code.

item.title: My Superpower
item.description:
If I had a superpower, I would have the superpower to fly really fast. I would have that power because I think it would be amazing to fly up to the giant clouds and get to places quickly.

I would help people with my superpower by flying up high to look for a little girl’s doll that she lost, or saving a young boy from falling off a high edge. I would help with anything else anyone needed. I am Scarlett the amazing superhero!

item.title: Holes
item.description: In the book Holes there is a boy named Stanley. He went to school and was a pretty big kid, and he got laughed at for that. One day, he was walking under a bridge on his way home from school and from out of the top of the bridge, shoes fell down on him. They were a famous baseball players shoes. The cops came by and took him to court. They gave him the choice to go to jail or Camp Green Lake. He chose Camp Green Lake.

item.title: Report Cards
item.description:
Fall 2025 Grades

Subject Grade
Math A+
ELA A+
Writing A-
Reading A+
Social Studies A+
Spelling A+
PE A+
Music A-
Extracurricular A+

Key Achievements

Scarlett is making excellent progress toward mastering 4th-grade Math and English, as evidenced by her strong performance in Khan Academy and Lexia. In Math, she has completed more than 50% of the curriculum with 100% mastery. In Lexia, she passed Core 16 with a 95% score and Core 17 with a perfect 100%.

item.title: 100 Dresses
item.description:
The Hundred Dresses, by Eleanor Estes. The theme is forgiveness.

In the book The Hundred Dresses, there is a girl named Wanda. She went to school like any other normal kid, but she had been missing school. In Wanda’s class there was a bunch of kids, but Peggy was the prettiest. Peggy’s best friend was Maddie. They did everything together. Maddie thought she knew why Wanda was missing school. It all started on a beautiful day, Wanda got to school and Peggy asked Wanda how many dresses she had. Wanda only had one dress but she didn’t want to tell everyone that so she said she had one hundred, all lined up in her closet. Everyone started asking her that every day and Maddie could tell that was making Wanda feel uncomfortable. That was why Wanda wouldn’t come to school. Maddie felt bad and so did Peggy.

item.title: One Mile Race
item.description:
I trained for a one-mile race once. Every Wednesday, I would practice.

  • On the first Wednesday of practice, I ran two minutes and walked one minute five times.
  • On the second Wednesday, I ran three minutes and walked one minute four times.
  • On the third Wednesday, I ran five minutes and walked one minute two times.
  • The fourth Wednesday I ran a whole mile without stopping to walk.

I ran with some of my neighbors from Crocker Court, so we made shirts that said Crocker Cruisers. It was a blast!

item.title: 5k Adventure
item.description:
Get ready for an awesome adventure to become a super stretcher and a 5K running champ! You’ll learn fun stretches, make a training schedule, and train to run 3.1 miles with a big smile.

Making a Training Plan

Open up Grok and introduce yourself. Grok will help you create a plan tailored specifically to you. To start the discussion, type in:

I'm a 9 year old girl and I'd like help creating a 5k training plan. 
I'm starting today, and my race is on October 18th. 
Let me tell you a bit about myself before you create the plan.

After the introduction, Grok will want to know 2 things:

item.title: Cupper
item.description: You don’t want to edit this file :-)

item.title: Egg Free Baking
item.description:
Hi there, young baker! Baking is like magic—you mix simple things and turn them into yummy treats. This lesson is all about making egg-free cookies (maybe chocolate chip or something fun like that!), a super easy recipe that’s perfect for beginners. You’ll do most of it yourself, but remember: Always have a grown-up nearby for safety, especially with the oven.

Find a Recipe Online

Baking starts with a good plan! Recipes are like treasure maps that tell you exactly what to do. Today, we’re making egg-free cookies because they’re yummy and safe for everyone—even if someone can’t eat eggs. You get to pick your own recipe this time!

item.title: Grok & Quill
item.description:
Daily Writing

Hey there, writer! Grab your journal and write about your day, a book, or a fun discussion. Make it awesome!

Watch this video, then use one of its 6 cool tips in your writing. You got this!

Grading with Grok

Next, practice typing! Type up your journal entry for some keyboard fun.

item.title: Habitat-orama
item.description: A diorama is like a tiny world you build to show a scene, like a forest, desert, or even a superhero hideout! It’s a small model made on a base, like a piece of cardboard, where you add things like grass, rocks, trees, or buildings to make it look real. Think of it as a 3D picture you can touch, kind of like a toy set or a scene from a movie, but you make it yourself with crafts! It’s fun because you get to create every part of your little world.

item.title: Hunt & Sketch
item.description:
Geography: Finding Korea

Open the Apple Maps app on your iPad. Pinch to zoom out super far—you’ll see the whole globe! Spot South Korea and Kansas. Fun hunt, right?

Hey explorer! Use Apple Maps, Grok, or Google to answer these cool questions:

  1. What’s the capital of South Korea?
  2. Could you walk to South Korea from Kansas? What about sailing there by boat?
  3. How many miles from Kansas to South Korea’s capital?
  4. How long to fly that adventure?
  5. What’s South Korea’s time zone? Kansas’s? If it’s 3 PM in Kansas, what’s the time in South Korea?

Culture: K-Pop & Demons

The movie K-Pop Demon Hunters pulls from real Korean tales. Watch this video to discover awesome cultural bits!

item.title: World Animals
item.description:
Find Your Animal

Lots of cool animals live all over the world! Some call certain continents home, while others love places like hot tropics or dry deserts. These are their special habitats. Can you discover some fun facts about 1 animal in each of these 8 places?

North America South America Asia Australia Africa Farm Animals Tropics Reptiles

Reference the animals found in Sedgwick County Zoo for a list of what’s available to see in person.
